comment: Professor Mukta was very sweet. I liked her class and she made sure to check if anyone had questions while she was going over content. I would recommend sitting in the front because you can ask questions when confused and she isn't weird about answering. No notecard for tests but if you study and do Aleks they're not too bad. I would take her again

Her accent is that bad at all. If you take the time to understand. But, she rushes through the material and doesn't use review time for test. 4 tests and they are completely different then what you are learning nor does she look at emails. Let's not forget a 3x5 flash card for a 14 question test with 20 topics on one test. NEVER AGAIN!

She is super friendly and I truly believe she means well... the accent is tough to get used to and sometimes confuses everyone, she goes through the material relatively fast but always takes questions and explains to the best of her ability. I can't stress enough how nice she is, and she does have the best intentions and cares a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She is a very lenient test grader and gives bonus points for completing the study guide. She's one of the better math teachers there are. Go to class pay attention and ask her questions, she's more than willing to help you understand. I would suggest trying on aleks as it helps a great amount w learning I would take her for all my math classes
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This is the WORST teacher I've ever had! She not only has a thick accent but also rushes through material. We were supposed to have a student assistant in our class but they quit from being overwhelmed by people who needed help. There is also only 3 test in this whole class so if you are not a good test taker good luck. DO NOT TAKE THIS TEACHER.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: To be honest, if it wasn't for ALEKS, I probably wouldn't have done as well as I did. If you are proficient at Math, her class wouldn't be difficult for you because you already understand basic concepts. People are too scared to ask questions and that is their down fall. But she is really nice and very helpful when you communicate.

I had to Withdraw from this class. She is a very nice person but not a good professor. If you struggle with math avoid taking this class. She speeds through multiple topics before a test and gives you work through aleks. If you have to take her, please ask questions and make efforts to teach yourself and/or get tutoring.

Don't take her if you don't already have a very solid understanding of algebra. She moves through topics so quickly that nothing really sticks by the time you get to the test which is weighed very heavily. There are only three tests so if you fail one you're basically done for even if you get all other available points. Save yourself the struggle.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Avoid this prof if you can. Very hard to understand and moves way too fast in lectures. Lectures consist of her speeding through topics saying "Does this make sense?" when none of it makes sense. I basically had to teach myself every single topic through Aleks with the help of my mom who is a math teacher.

She is a super nice teacher, but she teaches her lectures super quickly and all in one period. She uses ALEKS for homework assignments, and she gives extra credit study guides for tests, which are worth 5 points. Often, the online work given, goes over concepts that weren't discussed in the lecture. She is always willing to help you out though.

She was a good teacher, super sweet, super nice, however her lectures were very long yet she goes very quickly. Once she finished a topic, she jumps right into another and uses all class period and crams all the topics she can in one day. It's hard if you are already struggling in math, and her tests weigh a lot. If you fail a test, you're done for

She goes very fast in class and sometimes you'll fall behind. She is really nice and answers any questions. All of the homework is through ALEKS and the study guides too which if you get a 90% or higher you gain 5 bonus points on the test. She only has 3 tests and a final, which are worth a ton of points so u really can't fail.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Online Savvy
